Posts.Title: Great news StephB debbie6122

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2011 12:31AM snookiejc wrote: Yes, I would go back to the doctor asap.  Just let them do the tests to rule everything out.  I still have no idea what the pain/swelling in my leg was, but my chest pain ended up being two ribs that had "popped" out of place from the surgery.  The pain was so bad, and no one could figure it out.  I went to my chiropractor and told him everything I had been going through... he took one look and knew exactly what my problem was. One adjustment, and I could breathe again!  Who knew about "slipping rib" syndrome?  I didn't.
Posts.Title: Leg swelling after excisional biopsy? snookiejc snookiejc

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2011 10:39PM snookiejc wrote: So after having the leg swelling, then the ultrasound ruling out a DVT.... A week later, I ended up with increased pain in my calf and sudden chest pain.  I happened to have another check-up with my breast surgeon that same day, and I told him about my current symptoms.  (I never told him about the first episode of swelling in my calf/ankle, because he always seems too busy)  He completely freaked out on me, and sent me directly to the hospital for a stat CT pulmonary angiogram and stat bilateral lower extremity ultrasound.  I guess he was seriously concerned that I did, in fact have a DVT and possible a pulmonary embolism.  Thankfully, all the tests were negative and the pain in my leg went away again, but the heaviness/pain in my chest persists.  The CT revealed a hematoma in the location of my surgery, but didn't say how large it is. My regular doctor called to tell me abot the hematoma, (I haven't heard from the BS since the tests) and she told me that it could be causing radiating pain across my chest.  Has anyone experienced this?  Any advice?  I had almost no pain in the first week followng the surgery and as the days pass by, it seems the pain is increasing.  Odd, right?
Posts.Title: Leg swelling after excisional biopsy? snookiejc snookiejc

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2011 10:48PM snookiejc wrote: Just had mine removed last Thursday.  It was 1.6cm, and although it's benign, I feel better knowing it's not there... at least I think it's not there.  I swear I still feel it, and I'm going in for my post-op visit tomorrow, so we will see what he says.  Maybe it's just a swelling of some sort.  Good luck on your decision.

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2011 12:51AM snookiejc wrote: I wish I had some answers for you, but I'm too inexperienced with this topic to know how to respond, but I did want to say that I'm thinking of you, and that I can relate to the watching/waiting/wondering thing.  You're right, it IS NO WAY TO LIVE.  Are you sure there is no way to have it checked really quickly before your trip?  I hope you get some answers soon, and I'm sure some of the other ladies on this site will have much better advice, but please keep us posted and have a wonderful vacation!
